doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: 18th century; alteration: 1835; alteration: 1837; alteration: 1859; alteration: 1933

One of the largest antebellum houses in the county--Rev James Maury, mid 18th century log school site--Dr Charles Hancock Home--Similar to Logan nearby, the home of Maria Lindsay Walker, sister of Elizabeth Lindsay--Mantel & Bookshelves from Philadelphia

Brick I-House, 1933 2 Tier Portico, 3 Bay, T-plan, Flemish Bond, Queens Closers, Kings Closers, 5 Course American Bond, 7 Course American Bond, Running Bond, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Circular Saw Marks, Clay Floor Insulation, 2 Leaf Door, Symmetrical Trim, Transom, 6/6; Log Glebe & School
survey data: Architecture in Virginia--Virginia Road Traces--Work Projects Administration
Log Glebe of Fredericksville Parish & Classical School--Burned --Brick I-House--WFG Incised Brick--Frame Addition--2 Tier Portico, Wings & Brick Veneer of Addition
